key_points: There's currently no proposal for a fourth round of stimulus checks as Congress focuses on other priorities.
Despite some Democratic support for recurring payments, slim majorities and a previous focus on limiting the third round of payments make further direct payments unlikely.
Lawmakers are now concentrating on a massive infrastructure bill and President Biden's American Families Plan, neither of which includes direct payments.
The Internal Revenue Service is still making payment adjustments for those who lost income in 2020 and are due more from the third round of payments.
The plus-up payments are automatically going to individuals whose 2020 tax returns show they qualified for more based on their income.
The expanded child tax credit payments, as part of the pandemic aid package passed in March, will begin on July 15.
More than 36 million families are eligible for the child tax credit payments which will be periodic.
Eligible parents will receive up to $3,600 for each child under 6 and $3,000 for each child under 18, an increase from the previous maximum of $2,000.
The enhanced child tax credit will benefit single parents making up to $75,000 and joint filers making up to $150,000 a year.
The child tax credit has been made fully refundable, potentially benefiting 20 million more children.
